intro: Dischidia dohtii, commonly known as the climbing dischidia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is a trailing or climbing vine characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found growing on trees or rocks in humid, tropical environments. Dischidia dohtii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in shaded conditions.
